column1: #Text=[0264] As the off-gas of the membrane separation reformer (line B103), there is obtained a mixed gas having a total gas flow rate excluding steam of 23.6 kmol/h, a CO.sub.2 concentration of 52%, and a hydrogen concentration of 34%.

#Text=The mixed gas is dewatered with a dewaterer (not shown) and then introduced into the hydrogen separation membrane B3 provided with a polyimide membrane having a CO.sub.2/hydrogen permeability coefficient ratio .alpha. of 0.11.

#Text=On the permeation side of the hydrogen separation membrane, there is obtained 3.2 kmol/h of a gas (line B105) having a hydrogen concentration of 78% and a pressure of 0.1 MPa, which is recycled upstream of the membrane separation reformer B1 through the compressor B6 and the line B106.

#Text=[0265] On the other hand, the non-permeation side gas (line B107) of the hydrogen separation membrane is introduced, at a pressure as it is, into the CO.sub.2 separation membrane B4 equipped with a membrane having a CO.sub.2/hydrogen permeability coefficient ratio .alpha. of 30.

#Text=The permeation side gas (line B108) of the CO.sub.2 separation membrane has a CO.sub.2 concentration of 95%, which is pressurized to about 8 MPa by the compressor B7 and then fed into the CO.sub.2 liquefier B5 (line B109) to yield 9.1 kmol/h of a liquefied CO.sub.2 flow (line B110).

#Text=The non-permeation side gas (line B111) of the CO.sub.2 separation membrane and the off-gas of the CO.sub.2 liquefier (line B112) are combined to form a gas flow (line B113), which is sent to the reformer burner 1e, used as a fuel for combustion in the reformer, and then discharged (line B122).

#Text=[0266] The energy consumed by the compressors in this process is 5.6 kW/kmol-recovered CO.sub.2, and the carbon dioxide recovery rate as a liquefied CO.sub.2 based on the amount of CO.sub.2 contained in the membrane separation reformer outlet gas (line B103) is 74%.

#Text=[0267] The permeability coefficient ratio .alpha. of the carbon dioxide separation membrane, the amount of high purity hydrogen recovered, the amount of carbon dioxide recovered, and the energy consumption (sum total) of the compressors per 1 kmol of the recovered liquefied carbon dioxide are shown in Table B1.
#Text=The heat and mass balance is shown in Table B4.
